intro: Galium jordanii var. bretonii, commonly known as Breton's bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant features slender, ascending stems covered in fine hairs, and its small, white or pale pink flowers are arranged in clusters. It produces small, oval berries that are typically red when mature. Breton's bedstraw is often found in rocky soils and open woodlands, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
